title: Investigate current SnD port codebase
description: Investigate the current state of the Mudlet Search and Destroy port. Document: 1) Complete inventory of all ported modules and their completion status. 2) Analysis of original SnD source vs current Mudlet port. 3) Architecture overview of the Mudlet port. 4) Gap analysis - what remains to be ported. 5) Technology assessment (Mudlet API, Lua patterns). 6) Dependency map between modules. Output: architecture.md with complete findings.

title: Implement core SnD modules
description: Implement the highest-priority Search and Destroy modules in Mudlet/Lua: 1) Core hunt/kill targeting system. 2) Navigation and room tracking. 3) Combat state machine. 4) Equipment management. 5) Configuration system. All implementations should follow Mudlet best practices and be testable.

title: Refinery Patrol
description: Merge queue processor patrol loop with verification gates.

title: Test suite for SnD Mudlet port
description: Create comprehensive test coverage: 1) Unit tests for each ported module. 2) Integration tests for module interactions. 3) Regression tests against original SnD behavior. 4) Edge case handling. Target: functional parity with original SnD.

title: Deacon Patrol
description: Mayor's daemon patrol loop for handling callbacks, health checks, and cleanup.

title: Plan SnD port implementation strategy
description: Based on the investigation, create a detailed implementation plan: 1) Priority-ordered list of modules to port. 2) Technical approach for each module (direct port vs redesign). 3) Testing strategy for each module. 4) Integration plan for modules. 5) Milestones and acceptance criteria. Output: implementation-plan.md
